greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Josephus problem: Records in the rows of A321781.
comment: For a given initial position j among the n persons in the Josephus problem, there exists a smallest elimination parameter q, meaning every q-th person being executed, by which position j can be made to survive. a(n) gives the maximum of q taken over all initial positions 1 <= j <= n. The value of j, for which the maximum q occurs, is given by A321794.
link: Hugo Pfoertner, Table of n, a(n) for n = 2..400
Index entries for sequences related to the Josephus Problem
results.author: _Hugo Pfoertner_, Nov 19 2018
